Case reference: 2014032043.CaseDesc:
On May 22nd, 1970, Philomena Sisson, age 68, was reported missing by her son, Harry Jack.  She had gone missing a few days earlier from his house on Boys Rd. in Duncan, BC.  Mrs. Sisson was reported to be an alcoholic who occasionally went missing for several days at a time. She also suffered from dementia. 
 
Mrs. Sisson's last surviving son has since passed away.  There was never any indication of foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003132.CaseDesc: On December 29, 1978, Sharon Drover was seen for the last time. Ms. Drover left her boarding house located in downtown St. John's, Newfoundland and arrived for her evening shift at McDonald’s restaurant. She finished her shift after midnight.

Case reference: 2023011080.CaseDesc: Keenan Venuk was last seen by her family in November 2017, and was last heard from via text message in February 2018. Keenan may be in Montreal, Quebec or Vancouver, British Columbia.

Scar: Unknown, Multiple linear scars on forearms
Tattoo: Left Ear, Pink music note, possible treble clef

Case reference: 2006016199.CaseDesc: Erich Striewski left Canada in his sailboat "Rochelle."  He was last seen in Aruba, stocking up with supplies. He left Aruba on February 12, 1992, and intended to sail to Panama. Neither Mr. Striewski or his boat have been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2012020057.CaseDesc: Peter Halcrow was last seen on March 14, 1994 walking in the "Sawmill" area between 14:00hrs and 15:00hrs.  Peter has not been seen since.

Shoes: Leather, Green, White, Reebok with purple

Case reference: 2016050007.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2016, the day of his birthday, Martin Ste-Croix was seen for the last time as he left his family residence. He told his family that he wanted to go to western Canada, specifically to Kelowna, British Columbia, to look for work. Martin left without his passport, little money and clothing.

Case reference: 2014002350.CaseDesc: On May 29th, 1990 Pierre Beaudoin left his residence in Hebron, Prince Edward Island. Police later confirmed that Mr. Beaudoin stayed at the Hotel Francis in New Richmond, Quebec and was seen for the last time on May 31, 1990, when he checked out of the hotel. Pierre’s truck and personal belongings were found in a dense, wooded area approximately 45 miles southeast of Route 275 in Balmoral, New Brunswick on August 17th, 1990.

Case reference: 2014004946.CaseDesc: On April 21 2007, vehicle belonging to Richard Gallegos was found near the Niagara Falls, in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Richard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020010632.CaseDesc: April Parisian was last seen at Yale, British Columbia, on or about March 28, 2021. April has not been seen or heard since.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2012020010.CaseDesc: Jacek Laskowski was reported missing on May 3, 2005, from Calgary, AB.  Information suggests that he may have been last seen in the Golden, BC area.

Case reference: 2008007999.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, Charles Leslie Lewis and a friend were out fishing on Gull Rock Lake approximately 10km south of Red Lake. While they were out on the lake the winds picked up and began to create large waves, which caused the boat to capsize. Mr. Lewis and his friend clung to the bottom of the boat but were pushed off several times by the waves. Mr. Lewis was washed away from the boat. As he attempted to swim back to the boat, his head kept going under water.  At one point he did not resurface.

Jacket: Canvas, Brown, Orange, Hunting - ONG shoulder patches

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2014006562.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2014, Kamalanathan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Markham, Ontario. His backpack, which contained all of his personal effects and his identification, was found near the Horseshoe Falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019040401.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1975, this approximately 60 year old man collapsed on East Hastings Street in Burnaby, British-Columbia. He had a bruise on the left side of his head and had recently undergone cranial surgery due to a head injury.

Case reference: 2014004498.CaseDesc: Guillermina Coleman left her residence in the Cypress View Foundation between 8:00 p.m. on July 4, and 10:00 a.m. on July 5, 2004. Mrs. Coleman was despondent, and was released from the hospital only a few days before she was last seen. Mrs. Coleman was only able to walk for short distances.

Case reference: 2012020658.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1993, Joyce Tillotson was last seen in Regina, Saskatchewan, when she left her residence to visit a friend. She never arrived at her friend’s home. Joyce was originally from the Carry The Kettle First Nation near Indian Head in Saskatchewan.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, "TR" text on bicep

Case reference: 2015011629.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2013 a man was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River on the banks of the Bellerive Park. He had a new cigarette pack, still packed in his right pocket of his coat. The man wore his watch on the left wrist. A backpack was found near the body in which there were clothes and an English book by JJR Tolkien "The Lord of the Rings".

Boots: Leather, Black, Dakota working boots; size 10; yellow sole
Coat: Black, President Stone with a hoodie; size XL
Hat: Black, Nascar racing cap written "Dupont Motor Sport" on top
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Milano brand watch
Shirt: Cotton, Dark Blue, Red, checkered; size XXL; written "Street Legal"

Case reference: 2019066843.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2019, Feng Qin Zhou, was reported missing from her residence on Firbridge Way in Richmond, British Columbia. She suffers from dementia and has previously wandered away from her residence. Feng Qin does not speak any English and speaks only in Mandarin.

Coat: Black, Long coat down to the knees with hood
Shirt: Pink, Long sleeve shirt with white writing
Shoes: Pink, Slippers with heel support and hard soles
Watch: Red, Two watches, one on each wrist

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Lee. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2019075256.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020 between 4:00 and 5:00 am, Joel Judd was last seen leaving a party at a residence in Slave Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014006149.CaseDesc: On February 7, 1971,  Selina Wallace spent the day with family and friends socializing. In the evening, Selina and friends went to a pier near the family home. The family last saw Selina on the pier with a male friend. When Selina did not return home the following day, family and community members searched the nearby area. The tidal currents near the pier are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Scar: Right Hand, Circular scar under right thumb, outside of hand

Case reference: 2015013522.CaseDesc: Richard St. Peter was in the process of moving residences. He was last heard from around Saturday March 14, 2015. It is not known where he may have gone, but he had vacated his last apartment and did not officially move into his new home.

Case reference: 2022022526.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2022, Jonathan White was last seen in Whistler, British Columbia. He was seen downloading from the gondola on the Blackcomb side and his last known location was the spit near Green Lake in Whistler. He was despondent at that time, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2012749001.CaseDesc: Lonnie Boudreau was last seen in the city of Ottawa in February 1981. He has not been heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Short, Straight, parted from left to right
Teeth: Good, Small gap between the two front teeth
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Beauty mark

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014006329.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2013, David Czerman was taken to Surrey Memorial Hospital for substance impairment.  Later that day, David discharged himself from the hospital and was given a bus ticket at approximately 19:40 hours. He has not been seen by his neighbours or family since November 21, 2013.  David Czerman was depressed and on pain medication for a medical condition.  Family described Mr. Czerman as a recluse, with no friends and only left his residence to go to the local pharmacy as he had trouble walking.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Dragon, Rose, bones skull
Left Forearm, Smurf, eagle, worm, heart
Right Forearm, Wizard, devil, rose, bird

Case reference: 2012020018.CaseDesc: Sahil Sharma has been missing from the Newton area of Surrey, B.C. since November 13, 2008.  On the day Sahil disappeared, he had attended to Kwantlen University in Surrey, B.C. to pay for his upcoming semester to study Information Technology.  Sahil did not have any known drug or alcohol addictions and no known mental health issues.  Sahil's disappearance is highly out of character and all avenues of investigation have not provided any information on his whereabouts.

Sweater: Grey, Red, Red stripes on the neck
Tattoo: Right Forearm, "RAM" written in Hindi symbols

Case reference: 2014003143.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1978, Diane Jaspersen, native of Calgary, Alberta, was last seen in Hope, British-Columbia. She was hitch hiking with her dog "Jack" on the highway leading towards Vancouver Island. Diane was headed to a friend's  cabin  where she was supposed to be staying and attend a festival, but never made it.

Case reference: 2014004987.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2004, Cassandra Wright was seen for the last time leaving the Homewood Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Cassandra said that she would be back in the morning.

Case reference: 2014005794.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2012 at 11 p.m., Pierre Desjardins left his residence in Notre-Dame-de-Lourdes, Quebec on foot and has not been seen since. Pierre was known to live a transient lifestyle and had made suicidal comments in the past.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Castle with a dragon on the bicep

Case reference: 2014006301.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2013, at 4:30, Alexis St-Denis was at his residence in Trois-Rivières. He sent a text to several people saying “Im so sorry”. Later on, a passerby found a cell phone, wallet, and headphones belonging to Alexis on the Pont de Fer bridge on the river Saint-Maurice near Highway 40. He has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004062.CaseDesc: Steve Langlois left the Gascon's dock at Port Daniel on April 27, 1996 on a lobster fishing boat. The boat was then hit by a wave and capsized. Mr. Langlois has not been found.

Case reference: 2009004699.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1994, Kenneth Blais, 27 years of age, had an argument with his mother. He left his residence on Levesque Street, Sturgeon Falls, Ontario, saying he was going to meet up with his father. The family assumed that Kenneth went to the Ottawa region. Kenneth never met up with his father and is still missing.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Cross done by hand

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2007005699.CaseDesc: Henry Pegahmagabow was last seen in the area of the Kipling Hotel on August 15, 1962.  His boat was found the next morning in the Parry Sound Harbour.  It is believed that he may have drowned in an attempt to return to Parry Island.

Case reference: 2013000092.CaseDesc: Jacques Boulanger was last seen on September 1, 1989 from Montreal. Jacques loved sleeping outside even though he had a home.

Case reference: 2014002562.CaseDesc: Michael Megraw, from Minnesota, USA, had visited the Katamik Lake area with his brother to go fishing over the September Labour Day weekend in September 1992.  Michael had returned to the US but was reported missing just days later, family indicated he was last seen on September 11, 1992.  RCMP received a call on October 3, 1992, about a truck at Katamik Lake which didn't appear to have been moved since September 24th; Mr. Megraw was determined to be the registered owner.  It is believed he returned to the lake somewhere between September 11 and September 24, 1992. Mr. Megraw has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006005199.CaseDesc: On Friday, July 1, 2005, at about 3:00 p.m., Laura Flanagan left her cottage to paddle her canoe around Hall's Lake. She was seen by neighbours to be alone in the canoe. A search of the lake located her canoe washed up on the east side of the lake. A further search of the lake failed to locate Ms. Flanagan.

Bathing Suit: Blue, Green, One piece, floral pattern

Case reference: 2014003620.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1980, Arthur Keefe was travelling with a friend on snowmobile when the pair went through the ice and into the water. His friend managed to climb out, but Mr. Keefe went under and it is not known whether he resurfaced.

Case reference: 2022014288.CaseDesc: Lauren Craven was last seen by his family in Wildwood, Alberta on April 7th, 2022. Lauren was confirmed to be staying at the Grand Union Hotel in Coleman, Alberta from April 11th, 2022 till  check-out on June 16th, 2022. Lauren's vehicle was located abandoned near Sparwood, British Columbia on August 26, 2022 with a Lethbridge Prairie Post newspaper dated June 17th, 2022. Lauren was showing signs of early-onset dementia.

Case reference: 2009004899.CaseDesc: Sacha Latulippe left Montreal Airport for Mexico city on October 15, 2009. He advised his family he was leaving for business. Investigation revealed he had 2 wives in different towns and was leading a “double life”. He left with his business partner Eric Marcel on this same flight. Mr. Marcel is also missing.

Hair: Blonde, Brush Cut, Spikey/gelled, natural brown; Sideburns

Case reference: 2006013499.CaseDesc: Vital Vachon was last seen on May 1, 1973 when he departed a bush camp in Lucas Township, near Timmins, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016069147.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1974, the body of a Caucasian male was found on the CNR tracks, 200 yards west of the CNR Station, Hearst. A witness observed the remains on the tracks after an advancing train had passed. His post-mortem length was recorded as being 5’8” however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was described as having a medium build. He may have been wearing glasses according to police reports.

Teeth: Good, Missing upper left 3rd molar. Several of his upper and lower posterior teeth had amalgam restorations.

Case reference: 2011002199.CaseDesc: Sean Tan went missing from his residence, an apartment building on Huron Street in Toronto, on March 7, 2011. Toronto Police Service investigated but to date he has not been located. Mr. Tan  may be despondent and suicidal.

Case reference: 2013000036.CaseDesc: Pierre Roy was last seen on January 28, 1983.  He was involved in an altercation in a bar in Montreal and has not been seen since.

Teeth: Braces, Wears 2 dentures, the top one is welded
Scar: Right Leg, 2 scars on each side of 5" long

Case reference: 2018032776.CaseDesc: On Tuesday, June 12 2018, Christian Robinson was seen for the last time leaving his home in the 6th Line and Simcoe Rd. area in the Town of Bradford, Ontario.

Backpack: May have a backpack with unknown contents
Shirt: Grey, Golf, White and yellow pattern on the chest

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2006011099.CaseDesc: Kenneth Richard Wolfe was working on Caribou Lake, (15 km north west of Armstrong, Ontario). On October 8, 1970, he left alone in a 16 foot steel boat to work on a dock. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Wolfe.

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 1999003370.CaseDesc: Nancy Liou was last seen at home on January 27, 1999. On January 28, her father contacted Nancy's school to see if she was there, and was advised they had no way of knowing if she was in attendance as it was exam time. Her father contacted police that evening when she failed to return home from school.  She had advised a family member she was leaving but never said where she was headed.

Case reference: 2014000005.CaseDesc: Kenneth Chester Fehr was last seen on November 27, 2012, at approximately 5:30 P.M. in the 1700 block of Idylwyld Drive North in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. He left behind his wallet and cell phone. Prior to leaving, he told numerous family and friends goodbye. He also spoke of harming himself.

Hair: Blonde, Wavy, Dirty blonde wavy hair down past his shoulders
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat pants. Work clothes stained with tar
Shirt: Cotton, Black, Work clothes stained with tar.  Could be grey in colour

Case reference: 2014005038.CaseDesc: On February 15,2005, Barry Sloper was last observed in the area of the Table Rock Complex in Niagara Falls, Ontario.  At the time of his disappearance, he was despondant.

Teeth: Other, Broken, missing upper teeth, partial upper dentures

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2020032400.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2019, Samantha Hiebert was seen for the last time by her friends and family in the area of Powerview-Pine Falls, Manitoba. During the time of her disappearance, Samantha had been seen at the Sagkeeng Employment and Income Assistance Office.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014001592.CaseDesc: Robert Mc Sween was reported missing by a family member on October 14, 1994. He was last seen September 18, 1994. The last contact he had with his family was by phone at the beginning of October 1994. Details of the coming and goings of Mr. Mc Sween are unknown by family members. His vehicle was found abandoned in the yard of a restaurant in Montreal.

Case reference: 2014006547.CaseDesc: Gregory Caesar was last seen near Watson Lake, Yukon Territory, in October, 2009. He was hitchhiking along the Alaska Highway and was believed to be heading to the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia.

Case reference: 2023010770.CaseDesc: Audrey Désilets was last seen on Highway 55 at the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières, Quebec, on March 5, 2023, at approximately 4:00 a.m. Audrey abandoned her car there and has not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Line and a heart

Case reference: 2014001281.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1982, a volunteer with Meals on Wheels reported to the police that, despite numerous attempts, they had not been able to contact Thelma Haskins. Police checked her home, however she was not there and they found nothing suspicious.  None of Mrs. Haskins' friends had seen her, and she had not frequented any local businesses.  Ground searches of the area and of the walking trails Mrs. Haskins frequented did not reveal any trace of her.  Mrs. Haskins has not been located.

Hair: Black, Short, hair is turning grey

Case reference: 2014002239.CaseDesc: On the August 24, 1993, Cynthia-Ann Peddle, commonly known as Cindy Paddle, was seen for the last time in Sept-Îles, Quebec. There is a possibility that Cindy frequented the area of Vieux Quai in Sept-Îles before her disappearance.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Faded Jeans, thigh pockets
Vest: Red, Pink, T-Shirt, Pink or red

Case reference: 2010003899.CaseDesc: Pierre Mercon, age 21, a lifelong resident of Vaughan, Ontario, was last seen at approximately 2:00 A.M. on November 1st, 1996. He was observed leaving the "Original Six" Sports Bar, located on Oxford Street in the Town of Richmond Hill, where he had attended a Halloween Party and was last seen wearing a costume of Army fatigues, work boots, a green wool hat and a long black wig. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Back of right shoulder, tattoo of Uruguay

Case reference: 2014006137.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2012, Spencer Joly was last seen in Vernon BC. Spencer told a number of people he was travelling to the Kelowna Airport and eventually flying to Phuket Thailand. Spencer was seen later that same day being dropped off by Taxi in Predator Ridge, a new housing development in Vernon. There was no record of Spencer ever leaving the country or arriving in Thailand.

Case reference: 2018033880.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2005, Quang Le was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005607.CaseDesc: Eleanor Eatha Parkinson-Jenkins was last seen on Monday March 1, 1982. At that time, she was living in Saint-Bruno-de Montarville. She was reported missing by her family. Ms. Parkinson-Jenkins had been ill for the past six months. She would normally leave a note when she left, but not that morning. She usually spent her days in bed or never went out alone. She would have left after the departure of her husband and did not take her purse with her. She left on foot and never came back. She is a originally from Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003046.CaseDesc: Yu Lowe was last seen on February 15, 1984 when he left his home in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Lowe said he was going to the movies and never came back.

Case reference: 2016059837.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2001, a male was found in the Detroit River, near 4200 block on Sandwich Street. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 138 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water a few days to a few months.

Hair: Short curly black hair on the left side of face
Teeth: Full gold crown on the lower left second molar
Jewelry: Braided, unknown if anklet or bracelet
Gold, Ears, Clear stone stud earrings
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Right Little Finger, 2 rings
Shirt: Black, Hooded sweatshirt with "Providence Friars" written on the front
Shorts: Blue, Gold, "Champion" brand short with the "University of Michigan" logo

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2014005583.CaseDesc: Mary Mark was a resident of east Vancouver in the 1970's. She did not apply for any government-issued identification or obtain social assistance, so information is very sparse on Mrs. Mark's life after 1975. It is believed that she met with foul play as the result of domestic violence. Her body was never recovered and the suspect is now deceased.

Case reference: 2021054828.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2021, at approximately 6:30 p.m., Berhanei Peynado was seen for the last time in the area of Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Berhanei was despondent.

Coat: Black, WINTER, Winter coat with fur collar
Hat: Black, Gold, BASEBALL, Baseball hat with gold maple leaf
Shoes: Black, White, RUNNING, Brand: Air Jordan
Tattoo: Chest, Wolf, arc angel with sword

Case reference: 2012020077.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1986, Alexander Wiwchar, 72 years old, was last seen at 2:00 p.m. in Yorkton, SK. Alexander, who lived on a farm near Canora, SK, was seen at the Yorkton Bus Depot. Alexander is believed to have had some medical concerns and was suspected of having Alzheimer’s disease. His destination was unknown and he has not been seen or located since.

Mark: Chest, 9th rib fractured on the right side

Case reference: 2014003860.CaseDesc: Carl Charles Raun was reported missing on July 28, 1975. Mr. Raun had a fused spine, causing him to wear a brace, as well as a scar from back surgery. There is a possibility that Mr. Raun disappeared as a result of foul play, however this has not been confirmed.

Case reference: 2021036748.CaseDesc: Paul Doughty was last seen on August 18, 2021 at a business near McKay Loop Road and Route 175, near Pennfield, New Brunswick.  On September 1, 2021 Paul's vehicle was located in a wooded area 10 kilometers north-east from Mckay's blueberry stand in Pennfield, New Brunswick. Investigators believe there is no foul play suspected.

Case reference: 2014006225.CaseDesc: On August 28, 2001, Erum KAMAL was seen for the last time near the High Level bridge in Edmonton, Alberta.  Erum was wearing a white t-shirt, blue pants and was described as a Southeast Asian from Pakistan.

Case reference: 2021037680.CaseDesc: Augustine Moloi went missing from Calgary, Alberta, in October 2008. Augustine's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Indigenous descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014005016.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2007, Jason Adam was seen for the last time near the Shaw Conference Center in Edmonton, Alberta. Jason left a family member’s residence on foot to meet with an ex-girlfriend for coffee. On the previous day, Jason had traveled from Lac La Biche, Alberta to Edmonton to attend a guardianship court hearing on October 22, 2007, but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2014001627.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1990, Robert Henson was seen for the last time riding his horse along the river in the Hummingbird Falls and Creek area in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta. While riding his horse, Robert was swept down the river.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2015026912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2015, Kandice Singbeil was seen for the last time by her boyfriend in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2021050906.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2012, at approximately 8:30 p.m., Gregory Mish was last seen near the American Falls, in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Gregory was despondent.

Scar: Head, 2 x 3 x 2-inch scar in the shape of a Z above the left side of his ear

Case reference: 2014005411.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1992, around 4:00 pm, Bernard Robitaille left St. Charles Boromée hospital after refusing treatment. He left on foot and has never been seen since. At the time of his disappearance he was carrying a Metro grocery plastic bag containing his personal belongings. The name and address of Mr. Robitaille was written on the bag.

Scar: Forehead, top of the right eye

Case reference: 2014005066.CaseDesc: James Douglas Turnball or Turnbull was last seen on the MV Princess of Vancouver vessel commuting from Nanaimo to Vancouver in the waters of the Howe Sound in 1966. Bowen Island RCMP are seeking any next of kin or close relations for the missing male.

Jewelry: Gold, Yellow, Black, black diamond ring
Gold, Yellow, Brown, Timex watch with leather strap

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2013000007.CaseDesc: Kimberly Ann McAndrew has been missing since August 12, 1989. At 4:20 p.m., she left the Canadian Tire where she was employed as a cashier. There were unconfirmed reports that Kimberly was last seen at the Gardenia Flower Shop in Penhorn Mall in Dartmouth. She was identified by an employee at the flower shop as having bought a balloon and a rose.

Shoes: Jade green, flat heeled slip on loafers

Case reference: 2013000129.CaseDesc: Immaculate Basil was last seen June 14, 2013 on a road in a remote area north of Fort St James, BC.

Case reference: 2012020081.CaseDesc: Emily Osmond (Laplante) lived a reclusive lifestyle on a small acreage on the Northern edge of Kawacatoose First Nation. Emily seldom had contact with her family or friends and the last known contact with them was August 29, 2007. She was last seen on the 9th of September, 2007, by her hired helper. Her disappearance is very unusual. Her vehicle and personal belongings including medication were left at her residence. She also had dogs at her acreage that she cared for that were left unattended. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Emily.

Case reference: 2014004459.CaseDesc: In the late summer of 1998, Charles Trottier was last seen by his family on the Kehewin Cree First Nations Reserve, near Bonnyville, Alberta. Charles may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002146.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1984, John Lake  was last seen leaving a hospital in Vancouver, British Columbia. He stated he was heading to Seattle.

Scar: Left Side Of Head, From ear to chin

Case reference: 2006013299.CaseDesc: Thomas Hesse was last seen on September 2, 1989 in Moonbeam Township, near Cochrane, Ontario.  He was riding a Raleigh, 3-speed, gold coloured, lady's bicycle.  Mr. Hesse left his parents' house in a depressed state and may have been suicidal.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2016061153.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1996, a male was found on the shores of the Detroit River in the 800 block of Front Road North, Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is described as balding, however, due to the length of time spent in the water, it is possible that his hair was lost after death giving the appearance of male pattern baldness. He is uncircumcised. His appendix is present. Changes to his heart suggest that he had high blood pressure and may have been treated for this. It is believed that he was in the water for days to weeks prior to his discovery.

Jewelry: Gold, Timex, watch with a gold-plated spandex band on his left wrist
Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Knights of Round Table, polo
Scar: Forehead, 3.8 cm on the right side

Case reference: 2014002449.CaseDesc: On July 27, 1997, Mike Tsannie was last seen traveling by boat across Wollaston Lake, SK. Mr. Tsannie’s boat was later found unoccupied, and searches failed to locate any trace of him.
